org.apache.felix.ipojo
Class InstanceCreator

java.lang.Object
  org.apache.felix.ipojo.InstanceCreator
All Implemented Interfaces:
FactoryStateListener
public class InstanceCreator
extends java.lang.Object
implements FactoryStateListener

The instance creator creates instances and tracks their factories. It allows creating instances from external factories.

Author:
Felix Project Team

private  class InstanceCreator.ManagedInstance
          This structure aims to manage a configuration.

Constructor Detail

InstanceCreator

public InstanceCreator(org.osgi.framework.BundleContext context)
Creates the instance creator. This object is generally a singleton.

Parameters:
context - the bundle context of the iPOJO bundle.
Method Detail

addInstance

void addInstance(java.util.Dictionary instance,
                 long bundle)
Adds an instance to manage.

Parameters:
instance - the instance configuration
bundle - the bundle id declaring the instance

removeInstancesFromBundle

void removeInstancesFromBundle(long bundle)
Disposes all instances declared by the given (leaving) bundle.

Parameters:
bundle - the bundle.

addFactory

public void addFactory(IPojoFactory factory)
This method is called when a factory appears.

Parameters:
factory - the new factory.

removeFactory

void removeFactory(IPojoFactory factory)
This method is called when a factory is leaving.

Parameters:
factory - the leaving factory

onValidation

private void onValidation(IPojoFactory factory)
This method is called when the given factory becomes valid.

Parameters:
factory - the factory becoming valid.

onInvalidation

private void onInvalidation(IPojoFactory factory)
This method is called when the given factory becomes invalid.

Parameters:
factory - the factory becoming invalid.

                         int newState)
This method is called when the state of a factory changes.

Specified by:

Parameters:
